Class GrundyRecPerdantes

java.lang.Object
GrundyRecPerdantes
class GrundyRecPerdantes extends Object
Grundy game with AI for the machine This program allows you to test the effectiveness of estGagnante() with a method more efficient

      boolean jouerGagnant(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Play the winning move if it exists
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if there is a winning move, false otherwise

    • estPerdante

      boolean estPerdante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      RECURSIVE method which indicates if the configuration (of the current game or test game) is losing. This method is used by the machine to know if the opponent can lose (100%).
      Parameters:
      jeu - current game board (the state of the game at a certain point during the game)
      Returns:
      true if the configuration (of the game) is a loser, false otherwise

    • estConnuePerdante

      boolean estConnuePerdante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Checks if the game state is not already losing using a database
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if the configuration is losing, false otherwise

      Testing a case of the method estConnuePerdante()
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      posPerdantes - the list of known losing positions
      res - the result expected by estConnuePerdante

    • estGagnante

      boolean estGagnante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Indicates if the configuration is winning. Method that simply calls "estPerdante".
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if the configuration is winning, false otherwise

      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      resJeu - the game board after playing winning
      res - the result expected by jouerGagnant

    • enlever

      void enlever(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, int ligne, int nb)
      Divide the matches from a row of games into two piles (1 row = 1 pile). The new heap is necessarily placed at the end of the table. The pile that is divided decreases by the number of matches removed.
      Parameters:
      jeu - table of matches by line
      ligne - pile for which matches must be separated
      nb - number of matches REMOVED from the pile (line) during separation

    • estPossible

      boolean estPossible(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Test if it is possible to separate one of the piles
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one pile of 3 or more matches, false otherwise

    • premier

      int premier(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai)
      Create a very first test setup from the game
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      jeuEssai - new game configuration
      Returns:
      the number of the pile divided in two or (-1) if there is no pile of at least 3 matches

    • testPremier

      void testPremier()
      Brief tests of the method premier()

    • testCasPremier

      void testCasPremier(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, int ligne, ArrayList<Integer> res)
      Test a case of the testPremier method
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      ligne - the number of the pile separated first
      res - the game board after a first separation

    • suivant

      int suivant(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai, int ligne)
      Generates the following test configuration (i.e. ONE possible decomposition)
      Parameters:
      jeu - gameborad
      jeuEssai - test configuration of the game after separation
      ligne - the number of the pile which was the last to have been separated
      Returns:
      the heap number divided in two for the new configuration, -1 if no further decomposition is possible

    • testSuivant

      void testSuivant()
      Brief tests of the method suivant()

    • testCasSuivant

      void testCasSuivant(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai, int ligne, ArrayList<Integer> resJeu, int resLigne)
      Test a case of the method suivant
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      jeuEssai - the game board obtained after separating a pile
      ligne - the number of the pile which was the last to have been separated
      resJeu - is the jeuEssai expected after separation
      resLigne - is the expected number of the heap that is separated
